result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberlynn D Leistikow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Restitution Stipulation filed.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Kimberlynn D Leistikow in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, defendant placed on 1 year probation, conds: 30 days jail starting September 3, 2015 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. $443 costs. Restitution of $1,376.09, periodic review in six months. No jail credit. Ct. 1 read in and dismissed.
